How Desert Dust Nourishes Phytoplankton.Description: Researchers have found that even modest amounts of desert dust can improve the health of the ocean’s microscopic, plant-like organisms.

High Flow at Glen Canyon Dam.Description: Water managers released a surge of water from the dam in late April to help preserve shrinking sandbars and shoreline habitats downstream.

A Deluge in Italy.Description: Heavy rains caused destructive flash flooding in the Emilia-Romagna region.

Shifting Sand Spits.Description: The shape of China’s Qinghai Lake changes in lockstep with climate.

Fires Scorch Western Canada.Description: Raging fires destroyed homes in Alberta and produced towering chimneys of smoke.

Deadly Blooms in the Gulf of Mannar.Description: Though Noctiluca scintillans blooms have long been noted in the shallow gulf, they have become more frequent and intense since 2019.

Popocat\u00e9petl Volcano Keeps on Puffi.Description: One of Mexico’s most active volcanoes continues to put on a show for satellites and astronauts.

Esp\u00edritu Santo Archipelago.Description: The island group off Mexico’s Baja California Sur has eroded slowly, preserving evidence of past human activity.

Tulare Lake Grows.Description: Flooding in the California lakebed continues to spread as spring brings snowmelt from the Sierras.

Freddy Brings Lean Times to Malawi.Description: Hunger is on the rise in Malawi after the tropical cyclone devastated crops in the southern part of the country.

Fires in Jalisco.Description: Hundreds of wildfires have burned in the Mexican state in 2023.

Utah\u2019s Dark Canyon Complex.Description: Petroglyphs, hanging gardens, and deep canyons make this remote landscape a notable part of Bears Ears National Monument.

Seasonal Flooding of the Diamantina Rive.Description: False-color images from Channel Country in the Australian Outback reveal a barren landscape transformed.

Country Roads.Description: The Blue Ridge Parkway is often the most visited national park site in the United States.

Mangroves on Eighty Mile Beach.Description: Trees along this stretch of western Australia have an elongated root system that allows them to withstand high and low tides.
